subject: p15131736
History: Year old woman with h/o COPD on L of home O2 FEV1 , HfpEF, and IDDM, desaturations, altered mental status, eval for pneumonia.
Findings: Since the prior study performed on, lungs are now better aerated. Bibasilar opacities persist, although or less consolidated in appearance compared to the prior radiograph. There is no new consolidation. Mild pulmonary vascular congestion. No pneumothorax. Marked cardiomegaly is stable.
Impression: Improving lung volumes and bibasilar opacities since, may represent resolving infection or atelectasis.
